contentList.content: Half-giants are widely known for their physical abilities, and for their ability to deal heavy damage to foes during combat, but they are typically shunned by many people for their hulking figures and often simplistic views on life and goals.
Half fire giants have dull skin and broad torsos. Their hair tends toward fiery colors like ginger and dirty blonde.
Half frost giants' skin has a bluish tinge, reflecting their giant parent's. They have very long hair, especially on their face in males.
Half stone giants are very slender-built, with thin, rectangular faces. Their hair is very short, and even females usually look almost bald.

Half storm giants are the largest and strongest of the half giants, just as their mighty parents are among the giants. They have dark-colored hair and emerald eyes. Their skin has a purplish tint that may be occasionally very bold.

Half hill giants are the smallest and least muscular of the half giants, just as their larger parents are. They have droopy facial features and very round stomachs. Their limbs tend to be short compared to their bodies.
Half cloud giants stand with an imposing physique, with statuesque facial features. They have pale skin and hair.
You are <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistant</LSTag> to Fire damage. Additionally, you can naturally <LSTag Tooltip="Target_IgniteBlade">ignite you weapon.</LSTag>
You are <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistant</LSTag> to Cold damage.
While not wearing armour, you add your Constitution <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag> to your <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag>
Half fire giants have dull skin and broad torsos. Their hair tends toward fiery colors like ginger and dirty blonde.
You are <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistant</LSTag> to Lightning damage.
You are an expert at moving through icy terrain, <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DIFFICULT_TERRAIN">Difficult Icy Terrain</LSTag> doesn't slow you down.

"Simple, deliberate, stubborn, and hulking." Half-giants are widely known for their physical abilities, and for their ability to deal heavy damage to foes during combat, but they are typically shunned by many people for their hulking figures and often simplistic views on life and goals.

Starting from 3rd level, you know the spell <LSTag Tooltip="Shout_FeatherFall">Feather Fall</LSTag>. Starting from 5th level, you know the spell <LSTag Tooltip="Target_FogCloud">Fog.</LSTag> Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

You know the <LSTag Tooltip="Projectile_RayOfFrost">Ray of Frost</LSTag> cantrip and can cast it at will. Starting from 3rd level, you know the spell <LSTag Tooltip="Projectile_IceKnife">Ice Knife</LSTag>. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells.
hen you make a Dexterity (Stealth) check to hide in rocky terrain, you are considered proficient in the Stealth skill.
You gain access to <LSTag Tooltip="Projectile_StormBolt">Storm Bolr</LSTag>. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

Half-giants are widely known for their physical abilities, and for their ability to deal heavy damage to foes during combat, but they are typically shunned by many people for their hulking figures and often simplistic views on life and goals.
Supreme Marshall of the Flaming Fist
Procurer of Associates, Stories, and Curios
Half frost giants' skin has a bluish tinge, reflecting their giant parent's. They have very long hair, especially on their face in males.

Half-giants are widely known for their physical abilities, and for their ability to deal heavy damage to foes during combat, but they are typically shunned by many people for their hulking figures and often simplistic views on life and goals.
Born in fire and flame, you channel the powers of Surtr, igniting your weapon, causing it to deal an additional [1]
You create a small blast of air capable of moving a creature back [1]
You can use your reaction to deflect the missiles from ranged weapon attacks. When you do so, the damage is reduced by [1].
You can use your reaction to deflect the missiles from ranged weapon attacks. When you do so, the damage is reduced by [1] + [2].
Channel the power of Stronmaus, Son of Annam, to hurl a bolt of lightning.
Annam All-Father was the chief giant deity and creator of the giant race, known also as the Prime, the Progenitor of Worlds, the Great Creator, and the Creator-By-Thought.
Hiatea was the giant goddess of nature, agriculture, hunting, females, and children. Her symbol was a flaming spear.
Grolantor was the giant god of hunting and battle, and the primary patron of the hill giants.
Memnor was the giant deity of pride and control. He was an ambiguous figure in the Ordning, whose tales concerning him were quite disparate with one another.
Skoraeus Stonebones was the giant god of craftsmanship and that which was buried, and was the primary patron of the stone giants.
Stronmaus was a neutral good greater deity of the giant pantheon, known as the Ordning, holding the portfolios of the sun, sky, weather, and seas.
While not wearing armour, you add your Constitution <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag> to your <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag>
Reduce the damage from a ranged weapon attack by 1d4 + your Dexterity <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag>
You can only reduce damage from the attack - any additional effects can't be negated.
A deep scratch runs down one side of the axe blade. It thrums with magic.
This weapon resonates with the ancient magic of the Giants, its song weaving through the air. The engravings hint at its history, revealing it was once wielded by a Bard of legendary acclaim.
Karontor was the giant god of disfigurement and hate, and the chosen patron of the malformed fomorians and the more villainous verbeeg.
Surtur, also seen as Surtr, was worshiped as the giant god of the fire giants.
Thrym was a titan worshiped by the frost giants as the giant god of cold and ice.

Diancastra was the giant demigoddess of wit and pleasure, a minor trickster deity of the Ordning. A goddess of many faces, Diancastra won her place among the giant pantheon through her daring, craftiness, and carousing ways.
Iallanis was the gentle giant goddess of peace and mercy. Represented by a garland of flowers, she was the symbol of love across giantkind and hoped that one day they could all live in harmony.
Weak, selfish humanoids. Though they often serve stronger races, they crave power and abuse what authority they obtain.
Weak, selfish humanoids. Though they often serve stronger races, they crave power and abuse what authority they obtain.

While not wearing armour, your <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> is equal to 11 + your Dexterity <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag>. In addition, you have <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to fire damage and psychic damage.

While not wearing armour, your <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> is equal to 11 + your Dexterity <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag>. In addition, you have <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to fire damage and psychic damage.
You have <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">resistance</LSTag> to fire damage and psychic damage. In addition, when you are wearing no armor, your AC is equal to 11 + your Dexterity modifier.
You are <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficient</LSTag> in <LSTag Tooltip="AnimalHandling">Animal Handling</LSTag>.

Dankwood goblins are much like any other run-of-the-mill goblin but they are much more gentle and artistic than the savage and uncouth goblins of the world. They are inquisitive and have a magical bond with the small forest creatures with which they are often friends. They are fast and numble and love to explore. Because of this they make great adventurers and guides.

Smaller and weaker than their cousins, and with larger hands and feet, goblins of the Grotag tribe attempt to live by their wits-though seldom with much success. The Grotag imagine themselves to have a sort of empathy with beasts, and they lose hundreds of goblins each year to ill-advised attempts at monster taming. But, every now and again, one of these efforts is successful.

The Lavastep tribe is the most industrious of the goblin tribes, and possesses much hard-won knowledge of the geothermal activity in Akoum. More so than members of the other tribes, the Lavastep goblins build surprisingly effective equipment out of the crystal shards and veins of strange metals that occasionally boil up to the surface.

Among the goblins, the Tuktuk are most likely to hire themselves out as ruin guides to other races. Of course, their usual plan is to help find something of value, steal it, trigger a trap intentionally, and then run.
You are <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficient</LSTag> in <LSTag Tooltip="SleightOfHand">Sleight of Hand</LSTag>.

The target takes an extra [1]. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Wisdom <LSTag Tooltip='SavingThrow'>saving throw</LSTag>, or you become invisible to it until the start of your next turn.
Invisibility will break if you make another action.
The target takes an extra [1]. The target must succeed a Constitution <LSTag Tooltip='SavingThrow'>saving throw</LSTag>, or be unable to move until the start of your next turn.
The target takes an extra [1] of the weapon’s type. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength <LSTag Tooltip='SavingThrow'>saving throw</LSTag> or be knocked prone.
The target takes an extra [1]. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength <LSTag Tooltip='SavingThrow'>saving throw</LSTag> or be pushed [2] from you in a straight line.

The target takes an extra [1]. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Constitution <LSTag Tooltip='SavingThrow'>saving throw</LSTag>, or it has disadvantage on attack rolls until the start of your next turn.
You gain the Strike of the Giants feat.

You grew up among giants. Maybe you were an orphan taken in by a sympathetic family of stone giants who raised you as one of their own. Or perhaps you lived in a lost prehistoric pocket of the world, surrounded by giants and fearsome behemoths or hulking dinosaurs. You have <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficiency</LSTag> in <LSTag Tooltip="Intimidation">Intimidation</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="Survival">Survival</LSTag>.

Goliaths wander a bleak realm of rock, wind, and cold. Their bodies look as if they are carved from mountain stone and give them great physical power. Their spirits take after the wandering wind, making them nomads who wander from peak to peak. Their hearts are infused with the cold regard of their frigid realm, leaving each goliath with the responsibility to earn a place in the tribe or die trying.

You can focus yourself to occasionally shrug off injury. When you take damage, you can use your reaction to roll [1] modifier to the number rolled and reduce the damage by that total. After you use this trait, you can’t use it again until you finish long rest.

You can focus yourself to occasionally shrug off injury. When you take damage, you can use your reaction to roll 1d12 + Constitution modifier to the number rolled and reduce the damage by that total. After you use this trait, you can’t use it again until you finish long rest.

You can focus yourself to occasionally shrug off injury. When you take damage, you can use your reaction to roll 1d12 + Constitution modifier to the number rolled and reduce the damage by that total. After you use this trait, you can’t use it again until you finish long rest.

You have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on Strength <LSTag Tooltip="AbiltyCheck">Checks</LSTag>, and your Speed increases by [1]. Once you use this trait, you can’t use it again until you finish a Long Rest.

You have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on Strength <LSTag Tooltip="AbiltyCheck">Checks</LSTag>, and your Speed increases by [1]. Once you use this trait, you can’t use it again until you finish a Long Rest.

You have <LSTag Tooltip='Advantage'>Advantage</LSTag> on Strength <LSTag Tooltip='AbiltyCheck'>Checks</LSTag>, and your Speed increases by Distance(3). Once you use this trait, you can’t use it again until you finish a Long Rest.
You are descended from Cloud Giants.
You are descended from Fire Giants.
You are descended from Frost Giants.
You are descended from Hill Giants.
You are descended from Stone Giants.
You are descended from Storm Giants.
When you hit a deal damage to a target, you can also deal [1] to them.
When you deal damage to a target, you can also deal [1] to them.
When you deal damage to a target, you can also deal [1] to them and reduce their <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">Movement speed</LSTag> by [2].

When you take damage from a creature within [1], you can deal [2] to them.

When you take damage from a creature within [1], you can deal [2] to them.
As a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">Bonus Action</LSTag>, you can teleport up to [1] to an unoccupied space.
When you deal damage to a target, you can also deal DealDamage(1d10,Fire) to them.
As a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">Bonus Action</LSTag>, you can teleport up to Distance(9) to an unoccupied space.
